Nooblety is an immersive game that transports you into a medieval universe set in Amboise during the Renaissance, spanning until the early Wars of Religion (1450‚Äì1574). You start off as a young peasant, but your goal is to climb the social ranks to become a respected noble.
We used Unity to develop the game, leveraging its powerful engine and tools to create an immersive and interactive experience for players.
C# was the primary programming language used in the development of the game, allowing us to create complex game logic and interactions.
Visual Studio was our integrated development environment (IDE) of choice, providing powerful tools for coding, debugging, and testing.
We used Plastic SCM for version control and collaboration, enabling us to work on the project simultaneously and manage changes effectively.
Coordinated the development team and ensured that tasks were completed on time.
Managed the git repository and resolved conflicts during the development process.
Oversaw the integration of assets and features into the game to maintain consistency and quality.
Planned meetings and discussions to align the team's vision and goals for the project.
: Implemented the character movement system, allowing players to explore the game world freely.
: Developed the dialog system for interactions with NPCs, enabling players to engage with characters and progress through the story.
: Programmed the camera control system to provide players with a dynamic and immersive view of the game environment.
: Designed and implemented the win condition for the game, defining the criteria for players to achieve victory and complete the game.
: Created various gameplay mechanics and systems to enhance the player experience and provide engaging challenges.
: Implemented the NPCs behavior and interactions
: chimney smoke, water mill, dynamic water, falling leaves, etc.
: Designed and developed the gameplay and gameplay mechanics.
: Developed the game using Unity and C#.

The game is set in the town of Amboise, a bustling medieval city during the Renaissance period. Your character is born as a humble peasant, and you have the freedom to choose how they will grow and evolve. You can focus on maximizing profits by selling crops and livestock, or take on the challenging path of building a network of relationships and a strong reputation among the different social classes. Once your character‚Äôs life comes to an end, they will leave behind a son, and you will then take control of the next generation‚Äôs fate.

With the resources and reputation accumulated by the previous character, you‚Äôll be able to choose a new occupation for the son. This new character, born with different opportunities, can then undertake various quests to gain the favor of the nobility. The game continues with each successive generation until your lineage either reaches the highly coveted noble status or the predetermined number of generations comes to an end.
Will you be able to guide your lineage to nobility and glory in this demanding medieval world?
: Choose your character‚Äôs path and make decisions that will shape their future.
: Manage your resources wisely to ensure the prosperity of your family.
: Build relationships with other characters to gain influence and power.
Serious game to learn about French cast society during the Renaissance

is an AI-powered tool that transforms YouTube videos into engaging vertical clips optimized for social media platforms like TikTok and Instagram Reels. By leveraging advanced AI models, Coco Bot automates the process of content creation, making it easy to generate short, captivating videos from longer YouTube content.
: Seamlessly fetch videos directly from YouTube using the video URL.

: Convert horizontal videos into vertical format, ensuring optimal viewing on mobile devices.
: Allow users to specify the desired length of the clips, catering to different social media platform requirements.
: Simple and intuitive interface for users to input video URLs and receive their clips.

MoseArt is a management simulation inspired by the real-life role of an IUT director. Each turn represents a quarter in a 5-year mandate. You balance budgets, satisfaction, and academic success, facing random events like pandemics, grants, or scandals.
Manage finances, satisfaction, and success rates
Invest in renovations, launch new programs, recruit staff
Make choices during events (e.g. pandemic, cold wave, grants)

Learn resource management and strategic planning
Discover the director‚Äôs responsibilities and long-term impact of decisions
Understand public relations and academic development
Strategic simulation game created in 48 hours, where you manage an IUT as its director.
STM32 Analog to Digital Converter, Timers & USART
is an embedded systems project carried out on an
, aiming to understand how different peripherals interact in a microcontroller environment.
into a single coherent system ‚Äî a small but complete embedded application built in
A popular development board based on the ARM Cortex-M3 architecture, ideal for learning embedded systems.
The primary programming language used for low-level hardware interaction and peripheral control.
Used for critical sections requiring precise timing and low-level hardware access.
The project explores three key parts of the STM32 ecosystem:
‚Äî controlling the brightness of an LED by adjusting the duty cycle of a signal.
‚Äî reading analog input from a potentiometer and internal temperature sensor.
‚Äî sending sensor data to a computer every second via the serial port.
Together, these elements form a simple
, where sensor readings are measured, processed, and transmitted automatically.
, I was responsible for the full setup and integration of the STM32 peripherals:
to generate periodic interrupts and PWM signals.
to capture analog values and convert them to digital readings.
to send temperature and voltage data to a serial monitor.
to manage synchronization and improve real-time behavior.
This required a solid understanding of
Reads the potentiometer and temperature sensor using the ADC.
Adjusts the LED brightness proportionally through PWM.
Sends both readings to the serial monitor via UART.
, illustrating how STM32 peripherals cooperate without relying on an operating system.
This project offered a practical introduction to
, bridging software logic and hardware control.
It demonstrated how to design reliable, low-level systems capable of interacting directly with physical components ‚Äî a crucial foundation for real-time and IoT applications.
Embedded systems project exploring the use of ADC, timers, and UART on an STM32 microcontroller.

Chess.rs is a chess game application built entirely in Rust using GTK-RS for the graphical user interface. This project demonstrates the power of Rust's memory safety and performance characteristics combined with GTK's mature GUI toolkit to create a fully functional chess game.
The application provides a complete chess experience with a clean, intuitive interface and all standard chess rules implemented, including special moves like castling, en passant, and pawn promotion.
: All standard chess rules including check, checkmate, and stalemate detection
: Real-time validation of legal moves for each piece
: Support for castling, en passant, and pawn promotion
: Tracking of game history, captured pieces, and turn management
: Automatic detection of checkmate and stalemate conditions
: Modern, native-looking interface built with GTK4
: Visual indicators for possible moves and selected pieces
: Current player turn, check status, and captured pieces
: Start a new game at any time
Core programming language for both backend logic and GUI development.
Rust bindings for GTK, used for building the graphical user interface.
Used for adaptive design, responsive layout, and seamless dark/light mode support.
A chess game built with GTK-RS and Rust.

FL Copro is a focused software that streamlines how property managers prepare, conduct, and follow up on condominium visits. It centralizes reports, photos, and building records in a clear interface designed for both field work and back-office review.

less friction during visits, faster data entry, and consistent reports that are easy to review later.
At-a-glance view with filters (type, dates, building) and sorting. A ‚Äúmy reports‚Äù toggle helps focus on your own work.
